Qualifications

Professional Qualifications

The standard way to qualify as an actuary in Canada is to pass a series of examinations set by either of two main bodies:

  • -Society of Actuaries (SOA)

    Which concentrates on life and health insurance, pensions, and investments.

  • -Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS)

    Which is concerned with property and casualty insurance.

University credits are not acceptable as an exemption to that of the society exams, but university courses can certainly help students to prepare for the exams. However, under the new system, certain approved university courses are validated towards SOA credits.

In order to apply to your first entry-level job as an actuary you should have written at least one exam. In practice at least three exams give you better chances of landing your first actuarial job.

You should try to have passed three exams by the time you graduate.

Links:

The Canadian Institute of Actuaries (CIA) is the national organization of the actuarial profession. Member driven, the Institute is dedicated to serving the public through the provision, by the profession, of actuarial services and advice of the highest quality. In fact, the Institute holds the duty of the profession to the public above the needs of the profession and its members.

The Society of Actuaries (SOA) is an educational, research and professional organization dedicated to serving the public and Society members. The SOA's vision is for actuaries to be the leading professionals in the measurement and management of risk.

ACTEX Publications is a specialty publishing house, committed to making a meaningful contribution to quality educational literature and professional opportunities in the actuarial science and related risk management areas. Issues products such as study guides and educational books for upcoming actuaries.
